oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Proclamation to the Inhabitants of Clarksville, Tennessee, from Andrew H. Foote
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Proclamation issued by Admiral Andrew Hull Foote, Flag Officer, Commanding Naval Forces Western Waters, US Flag Steamer "Conestoga," to the citizens of Clarksville announcing the U.S. capture of forts in the region and promising no molestation by the US naval forces against the peaceable people of the city. It also requires that all military stores and army equipment be surrendered.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides
Broadsides; Tennessee, History -- Civil War,1861-1865; United States, History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Clarksville, Tennessee; Foote, Andrew H. (Andrew Hull), 1806-1863
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Andrew Hull Foote
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Andrew Hull Foote was an American naval officer, anti-slavery activist, and commander in the American Civil War. He commanded the U.S. fleet on the Mississippi from 1861-1862.
